title: 45+ Funny Emoji Combinations That Are Trending on TikTok

steps.title: Use 👉 👈 if you want to ask a soft yet risky question.
steps.content: Use 👉 👈 if you want to ask a soft yet risky question. This emoji combo looks like someone is twiddling their fingers together while they work up the courage to say what’s on their mind. [1] X Research source It’s perfect if you want to admit your feelings to your crush or express that you’re nervous. You can also pair it with the 🥺 (pleading face) emoji to “simp” for someone, or give them excess attention. “Do you want to grab dinner next Friday night? 👉 👈” “I just wanted to tell you that I think you’re super pretty 👉 👈🥺”

steps.title: Text 🚪🏃‍♀️💨 if you’re heading out or running late to an event.
steps.content: Text 🚪🏃‍♀️💨 if you’re heading out or running late to an event. Think of this emoji combination as another way of saying “I gotta go.” Whether you forgot to pick someone up or you've decided to leave a lame event, it tells the other person that you’re dashing out the door. “I’m running behind, but about to leave my house 🚪🏃‍♀️💨” “Getting ready to leave 🚪🏃‍♀️💨 Do you need me to bring anything?”

steps.title: Send 🍿🤏😯 when something big is happening.
steps.content: Send 🍿🤏😯 when something big is happening. This emoji combo can be used to convey shock, interest, or eagerness for details. Let’s say your friend is spilling some tea. Replying with 🍿🤏😯 is like saying “No way! Tell me more.” Them: “Katie is breaking up with Matt right now!” You: “🍿🤏😯”

steps.title: Text 👁👄👁 when you’re in shock or disbelief.
steps.content: Text 👁👄👁 when you’re in shock or disbelief. With wide eyes and a slack-jawed mouth, the 👁👄👁 emoji combination conveys a surprised or bewildered look. [2] X Research source It’s sometimes used to connote the phrase “it is what it is,” meaning you have to accept a frustrating situation because there’s nothing you can do to change it. [3] X Research source “Did you see the election results? 👁👄👁” “Rumor has it that Taylor and Travis broke up 👁👄👁”

steps.title: Use 🕳👨‍🦯 to indicate you’re ignoring something.
steps.content: Use 🕳👨‍🦯 to indicate you’re ignoring something. When you come across something you don’t want to accept, 🕳👨‍🦯 means you’re pretending not to see it. [4] X Research source This could refer to red flags in a relationship or parts of your life you’re unsatisfied with. “Me ignoring all his red flags 🕳👨‍🦯” “I’ve learned to dissociate so I’m not sad 24/7 🕳👨‍🦯”

steps.title: Use 👩🤏👩‍🦲 when you’re amazed, stunned, or awestruck.
steps.content: Use 👩🤏👩‍🦲 when you’re amazed, stunned, or awestruck. The slang phrase “snatched” means something is fierce or “on point,” usually in terms of personal appearance. [5] X Research source If your friend is wearing a cute outfit or their makeup looks picture perfect, for example, use 👩🤏👩‍🦲 to compliment them. Them: “Did you see Rihanna’s look at the Met Ball?” You: “👩🤏👩‍🦲” Them: “I KNOW!” You: “She ATE and left no crumbs.”

steps.title: Reply with 🐂💩 when someone is talking nonsense.
steps.content: Reply with 🐂💩 when someone is talking nonsense. If someone is lying to you or being overly dramatic for no reason, use 🐂💩 to call out their behavior. It’s short, simple, and straight to the point! Them: “Did you hear they’re trying to revoke her gold medal?” You: “🐂💩”

steps.title: Use 😎🤏😳🕶🤏 to say “repeat that?” or “what did I just see?”
steps.content: Use 😎🤏😳🕶🤏 to say “repeat that?” or “what did I just see?” This emoji combination is the equivalent of doing a double take in real life. It conveys shock and disbelief, especially if the other person does something “sus” or questionable. Them: “I kissed Henry…” You: “😎🤏😳🕶🤏”

steps.title: Reply with 👉🙄👈 to ignore someone over text.
steps.content: Reply with 👉🙄👈 to ignore someone over text. If someone keeps giving you unsolicited advice or bringing up things you don’t care about, 👉🙄👈 is a quick way to move onto the next topic. It can come off as rude or childish, so avoid using it if the other person is being serious. “La la la la la la 👉🙄👈” “I can’t hear you 👉🙄👈”

steps.title: Send 😃👉🚪 if someone shares an unpopular opinion.
steps.content: Send 😃👉🚪 if someone shares an unpopular opinion. Most people use 😃👉🚪 to joke around with their friends, especially if they make a controversial statement. It’s a great way to make someone laugh and inject some lighthearted energy into the conversation. Them: “Shrek 3 is the best.” You: “😃👉🚪” Them: “?” You: “Shrek 2 is superior.”

steps.title: Respond with ☕🤏 if someone spills some juicy gossip.
steps.content: Respond with ☕🤏 if someone spills some juicy gossip. This emoji combo is another way of saying “the tea is piping hot.” In slang, the term “tea” refers to gossip or inside information. [6] X Research source So, shoot a ☕🤏 if someone shares news that’s particularly exciting, scandalous, or revealing. Them: “OMG, Blaire kissed Chris last night!” You: “☕🤏”

steps.title: Use 😌💅 when you’re feeling extra confident.
steps.content: Use 😌💅 when you’re feeling extra confident. Did you just get a fresh manicure or blowout? Drop the 😌💅 emoji combo to say you’re feeling fabulous! It can also convey sass, nonchalance, or self-confidence, especially if you’re entering your baddie era . “Just went to the salon to get a lash lift 😌💅” “I told him that I don’t play games and he better not embarrass me 😌💅”

steps.title: Drop 😃🖕 to flip someone off in a funny way.
steps.content: Drop 😃🖕 to flip someone off in a funny way. It’s a silly and sarcastic response you can use if someone is teasing you or being a little annoying. Some people use it to express nonchalance, especially if the other person brings up something embarrassing from the past. Them: “Your burnt cookies were a hit at the housewarming.” You: “😃🖕”

steps.title: Use 🕳🪂 to say goodbye a silly way.
steps.content: Use 🕳🪂 to say goodbye a silly way. This emoji combination features someone skydiving into a black hole, which can represent removing yourself from a situation. [7] X Research source If the other person is getting upset or defensive, you can send 🕳🪂 to calmly exit the conversation and give them time to cool down. Them: “You should have told me what he said.” You: “I didn’t want to ruin your night.” Them: “That’s irrelevant.” You: “🕳🪂”

steps.title: Send 😯☝️😐✊ to take back what you said.
steps.content: Send 😯☝️😐✊ to take back what you said. You can use this emoji combo in place of “nevermind” to save time and space while you’re texting. If you want the other person to ignore a previous text you sent, 😯☝️😐✊ can also be used to move forward in the conversation. Them: “I think we should take the train to Boston.” You: “...” Them: “?” You: “😯☝️😐✊”

steps.title: Send ☕️🐸 after making a shady comment about someone.
steps.content: Send ☕️🐸 after making a shady comment about someone. This silly emoji combo is based on a viral meme of Kermit the Frog sipping tea. People say “but that’s none of my business” after making a snide remark about someone, usually if they do something stupid or questionable. [8] X Research source “I heard they were caught stealing from CVS but ☕️🐸” “Julia’s mad at Beth because she was flirting with her man ☕️🐸”

steps.title: Use 🙄🤝😐 to reluctantly agree with someone.
steps.content: Use 🙄🤝😐 to reluctantly agree with someone. It’s the perfect response when someone forces you to do something you don’t want to do, such as going out when you feel like staying in. Think of it as another way of saying, “okay, I guess” or “only if you really need me to.” [9] X Research source Them: “We should go clubbing this weekend.” You: “🙄🤝😐”

steps.title: Send 🛌🏃‍♀️ when you’re sleepy and want to end the chat.
steps.content: Send 🛌🏃‍♀️ when you’re sleepy and want to end the chat. If you’re texting someone and it’s getting late, use 🛌🏃‍♀️ to tell them you’re heading to bed. It’s a simple way to end the conversation and imply you’ll talk to them later. “Talk to you tomorrow 🛌🏃‍♀️” “I’m heading to bed soon 🛌🏃‍♀️”

steps.title: Send 🛌🤺 if someone isn’t responding to you.
steps.content: Send 🛌🤺 if someone isn’t responding to you. If you’ve texted someone multiple times and they haven’t replied (or you think they’ve slept past all their alarms), 🛌🤺 is a funny way to say “wake up, sleepyhead.” Feel free to blow up their phone if you’ve made plans with them or need to share urgent news. “HELLLLOOOOO? 🛌🤺” “You need to wake up!!!! 🛌🤺”

steps.title: Use 🤸‍♀️🚊 if you see something cringy and want to share it.
steps.content: Use 🤸‍♀️🚊 if you see something cringy and want to share it. This emoji combo features a person cartwheeling in front of a train, which can symbolize the feeling of wanting to die from embarrassment. Send it to someone if you come across flat-out foolish behavior. “Just witnessed someone spill coffee down their shirt 🤸‍♀️🚊” “This drunk girl just crashed into a bunch of bar stools 🤸‍♀️🚊”

steps.title: Send 🤡🪞 to tell someone they’re acting ridiculous.
steps.content: Send 🤡🪞 to tell someone they’re acting ridiculous. The 🤡 (clown face) emoji represents silliness or foolishness, while the 🪞 (mirror) emoji represents awareness and self-reflection. Together, these two emojis can be used to playfully tease someone and tell them they’re “acting like a clown,” or being foolish. [10] X Research source Them: “I’m so mad I decided to get a bob. I should have listened to you and got a hime cut instead.” You: “🤡🪞”

steps.title: Use 🦗🦟🦗🦟🦗🦟 when you’re dancing and enjoying yourself.
steps.content: Use 🦗🦟🦗🦟🦗🦟 when you’re dancing and enjoying yourself. Whether you’re twerking , booty clapping , or busting out random moves, the 🦗🦟🦗🦟🦗🦟 emoji combination indicates you’re having a good time. Send it the next time you hit the club or throw a dance party in your bedroom. “I was twerking 🦗🦟🦗🦟🦗🦟 at the club.” “Megan Thee Stallion got me like 🦗🦟🦗🦟🦗🦟”

steps.title: Drop 🙄🤚 to quickly dismiss someone over text.
steps.content: Drop 🙄🤚 to quickly dismiss someone over text. If you don’t agree with what someone is saying or they rudely interrupt you, 🙄🤚 is a sassy way to shut them down. It will probably offend the other person or make them feel some type of way, so reserve it for the times you couldn't care less. “Um chile anyways 🙄🤚” “Back to what I was talking about 🙄🤚”

steps.title: Send 🎷🐛 when you’re listening to jazz music.
steps.content: Send 🎷🐛 when you’re listening to jazz music. This emoji combination doesn’t have much use in everyday conversation, but it’s so cute and silly that we had to include it! Text it when you want to invite someone to a jazz show, or when you’re talking about the genre in general. “Ya like jazz? 🎷🐛” “Want to go to a jazz club this weekend? 🎷🐛”

steps.title: Use 🌚🥂🌝 to raise a toast to your BFF and brighten their day.
steps.content: Use 🌚🥂🌝 to raise a toast to your BFF and brighten their day. If you want to celebrate your bestie’s success and make them feel good, 🌚🥂🌝 is the perfect emoji combo to shower them with love. Feel free to switch out the moon emojis with other emojis that suit your personalities. “Cheers to being single in the city 🌚🥂🌝” “Here’s to being thirty, flirty, and thriving 👸🏻🥂👸🏾”

steps.title: Text 🎤🦆 to encourage someone to share their thoughts.
steps.content: Text 🎤🦆 to encourage someone to share their thoughts. This emoji combo is a fan favorite on TikTok because the mic reaches the duck’s beak perfectly. Send it whenever your friend is feeling stressed and you want to encourage them to say what’s on their mind. Them: “I’m low key beefing with my roommate rn…” You: “🎤🦆”

steps.title: Use 🚂💭🚫🧐 if you suddenly forget what you were going to say.
steps.content: Use 🚂💭🚫🧐 if you suddenly forget what you were going to say. For the times you can’t think straight, 🚂💭🚫🧐 is a funny way to say your mind is going blank. Use it when you’re in the middle of a conversation and your concentration is interrupted. “Sorry, I just lost my train of thought 🚂💭🚫🧐” “I completely blanked during my interview 🚂💭🚫🧐”

steps.title: Send 😐😶😶‍🌫️🫥 if you’re leaving a party without saying goodbye.
steps.content: Send 😐😶😶‍🌫️🫥 if you’re leaving a party without saying goodbye. An “Irish goodbye” is when you leave a social gathering without telling anyone. [11] X Research source It’s moderately socially acceptable, so send 😐😶😶‍🌫️🫥 when you feel like vanishing or silently exiting a party. “I left the party like 😐😶😶‍🌫️🫥” “Me leaving any work function: 😐😶😶‍🌫️🫥”

steps.title: Use ✋😬🤚 to move on from a touchy topic.
steps.content: Use ✋😬🤚 to move on from a touchy topic. If you’re talking about something sensitive or controversial, send ✋😬🤚 to say you want to switch topics. It’s a lighthearted way to move forward in the conversation, especially if the other person might be getting upset. Them: “I can’t believe he cheated on me.” You: “Yeah, especially since you were way out of his league.” Them: “Girl, what???” You: “✋😬🤚”

steps.title: Use the 🫵🤣 emoji combo to playfully tease someone.
steps.content: Use the 🫵🤣 emoji combo to playfully tease someone. If they tell you a joke or do something stupid, send 🫵🤣 to poke fun at them in a friendly manner. It’s a great way to tease someone and let them know they made you laugh. [12] X Research source “Your jokes get me every time 🫵🤣” “I’m DEAD. You seriously thought you would marry Harry Styles 🫵🤣”

steps.title: Text ☝️😌 to pause the conversation or bring up another point.
steps.content: Text ☝️😌 to pause the conversation or bring up another point. Over text, it can be tricky to interrupt someone, but sending ☝️😌 is an easy way to give your two cents. Feel free to switch out the smiley face emoji with one that matches your situation. If you’re correcting your friend, for example, you could use the 🤓 (nerd) emoji to say “well actually.” [13] X Research source “I won first place in our grade spelling bee, not second ☝️🤓” “That reminds me ☝️😌 Didn’t you say you wanted to get a new piercing?”

steps.title: Drop 💪😎 if you’re feeling excited or energized.
steps.content: Drop 💪😎 if you’re feeling excited or energized. Most people use this emoji combination after they’ve completed a workout, but you can also use it to express excitement about an upcoming event or life in general. “I’m so excited for our daily walk 💪😎” “I changed my workout routine and I’ve never felt stronger 💪😎”

steps.title: Send 🫲🤨🫱 to get more details about a situation.
steps.content: Send 🫲🤨🫱 to get more details about a situation. It’s a silly way to ask follow up questions if your friend spills some gossip. According to some TikTok users, 🫲🤨🫱 can also be used to say “where’s my hug?” “So, I saw you and Johnathan were getting cozy last night…. 🫲🤨🫱” “I heard you hosted a party last weekend. Where was my invite? 🫲🤨🫱”

steps.title: Use 😶💬 when you’re in shock or can’t think of what to say.
steps.content: Use 😶💬 when you’re in shock or can’t think of what to say. If someone shares news or gossip that’s absolutely bonkers, 😶💬 is a perfectly acceptable response. It means you can’t think of an appropriate response on the spot. Them: “The entire marketing team got fired this morning.” You: “😶💬”

steps.title: Use 🫷😣🫸 when you’re feeling overwhelmed.
steps.content: Use 🫷😣🫸 when you’re feeling overwhelmed. If you just received earth shattering news, this emoji combination can be used to request some alone time. Send it whenever you need a breather or an extended period of peace and quiet. “I’m feeling so overwhelmed 🫷😣🫸” “Give me a moment to process that 🫷😣🫸”

steps.title: Send 👊🤠✋ to hype up your friends or family members.
steps.content: Send 👊🤠✋ to hype up your friends or family members. If you ever wanted to hit the nae nae over text, here’s your chance! This emoji combo is one of the funniest ways to hype someone up about going out. Send it as a warmup to the pregame or whenever you want to give them the giggles. “I can’t wait to dance the night away 👊🤠✋” “So excited to tear up the dance floor with you 👊🤠✋”

steps.title: Text 🙄⌚️👞 to tell someone to hurry up.
steps.content: Text 🙄⌚️👞 to tell someone to hurry up. If your friend or family member is running late, use 🙄⌚️👞 to tell them to get a move on. It conveys that you’re tired of waiting for them and they’re taking too long to meet up with you. [14] X Research source “Where are you? I’ve been outside for 10 minutes 🙄⌚️👞” “Ugh, I made dinner plans with Genelle and she’s 20 min late 🙄⌚️👞”

steps.title: Send 😚🤌 when something is unbelievably good or delicious.
steps.content: Send 😚🤌 when something is unbelievably good or delicious. People usually say something is “chef’s kiss” in reference to food. It’s supposed to resemble a chef kissing their pinched fingers because they made something super delicious. [15] X Research source “The linguine alle vongole is 😚🤌. Magnifico!” “I think I’m in love. He made me dinner and it was 😚🤌”

steps.title: Text 💨🚣 when you’re ready to leave a lame event.
steps.content: Text 💨🚣 when you’re ready to leave a lame event. The 💨🚣 emoji combo is a funny way to say you’re about to leave soon. It’s ideal for awkward happy hours, boring family events, and other situations that are borderline unbearable. “Aight, I’m finna head out 💨🚣” “This party is dead. I’m about to dip 💨🚣”

steps.title: Use 🧎🏼‍♀️🏌️‍♀️ to knock someone sense into someone.
steps.content: Use 🧎🏼‍♀️🏌️‍♀️ to knock someone sense into someone. If you’re talking to someone with their head in the clouds,🧎🏼‍♀️🏌️‍♀️ is a funny text to help them come back to reality. Feel free to use it if your friend is overthinking a situation or can’t get over someone who’s mid. “Dude, that’s not normal. Wake up and break up with her🧎🏼‍♀️🏌️‍♀️” “You are SO beautiful, and you don’t even know it. I wanna🧎🏼‍♀️🏌️‍♀️ you sometimes!”

steps.title: Send 👶🤾‍♀️🗑️ if a baby won’t stop crying or annoying you.
steps.content: Send 👶🤾‍♀️🗑️ if a baby won’t stop crying or annoying you. While you can’t perform the actions of this emoji combo in real life, you can always send 👶🤾‍♀️🗑️ to relieve some stress and give your friend a laugh. Use it whenever a baby or toddler is getting on your last nerve. “The kid behind me keeps kicking my seat 👶🤾‍♀️🗑️” “A baby was crying nonstop on my 16-hour flight 👶🤾‍♀️🗑️”

steps.title: Drop 🍧🦈 when you’re absolutely starving or hangry.
steps.content: Drop 🍧🦈 when you’re absolutely starving or hangry. It's a humorous way to say you’re super hungry and in need of food ASAP. People often use it when they’re hangry, or feeling angry or irritable due to hunger. [16] X Research source “I’m STARVING 🍧🦈” “Can we leave soon? I’m getting hangry 🍧🦈”

steps.title: Use 🥸🤏👓😎 to talk about a positive personal transformation.
steps.content: Use 🥸🤏👓😎 to talk about a positive personal transformation. In slang, a “glow up” most often refers to positive change in physical appearance and style. [17] X Research source Send 🥸🤏👓😎 if you’re having a glow up yourself or manifesting one in the near future. “I definitely glowed up post-college 🥸🤏👓😎” “I’m manifesting my glow up this summer 🥸🤏👓😎”

steps.title: Send 🤫🧏‍♂️ to share beauty tips on getting a stronger jaw.
steps.content: Send 🤫🧏‍♂️ to share beauty tips on getting a stronger jaw. Mewing is a viral TikTok technique that’s supposed to reshape and chisel your jaw. [18] X Research source It’s part of the larger movement of looksmaxxing, or doing whatever you can to improve your appearance. So, send 🤫🧏‍♂️ if you want to share some beauty secrets with friends. “The secret to a strong jawline is mewing 🤫🧏‍♂️” “Dude, you gotta start mewing to mog everyone in the room 🤫🧏‍♂️”

steps.title: Send 🙂🙃🙂✌️ when you’re getting angry or upset.
steps.content: Send 🙂🙃🙂✌️ when you’re getting angry or upset. The phrase “flipping out” refers to losing your composure, especially when someone makes you mad. [19] X Research source Use 🙂🙃🙂✌️ if you’re feeling on edge about something, or just can’t contain your emotions. “Ngl, I’m livid about the situation 🙂🙃🙂✌️” “I’m so nervous about the exam results 🙂🙃🙂✌️”

steps.title: Use 😐😑😐 when you’re apathetic about something.
steps.content: Use 😐😑😐 when you’re apathetic about something. This emoji combination is perfect for moments when you don’t know what to say. It signals that you’re bored, neutral, or dumbstruck, and it’s a funnier way to reply to someone (compared to sending a Tapback). Them: “I’ve been waiting at the bus stop for 10 minutes.” You: “😐😑😐”
